field.name: ID number
field.definition: a number that, as part of a well-defined scheme or convention, may be reliably referenced to recall or cite a resource

dos.practice: Enter the identifier, using digits, Roman numerals and/or letters as appropriate.

arXiv identifiers employ the following format: arXiv:0706.001v1. The 'v' is utilized to indicate versions of a given resource, and may or may not be present in the identifier. arXiv identifiers should begin with 'arXiv:'.
Call numbers have a variety of formats, and utilize both letters and Arabic numerals. Do not preface call numbers with 'Call' or any other text or symbols.

Citation/Article numbers have a variety of formats, and often take the place of page numbers. In such cases, do not enter page numbers, rather catalog the citation/article number. Enter the number exactly as it is found on the publication or in the citation. Do not preface citation/article numbers with any text, abbreviation, or symbol.

DOI names have two components; the prefix and the suffix. These are separated by a forward slash. The two components together form a DOI (e.g. 10.1000/123456). Enter DOIs exactly as they appear on the publication or in the citation. Do not preface DOIs with any text, abbreviation, or symbol.

EPRINTS identifiers are associated with an e-prints or online repository service. Each service has its own structure and format. Enter e-prints identifiers exactly as they appear on the publication or in the citation. Include prefixes that help to identify the associated service, but do not include generic prefixes such as 'no.' and '#'.
ISBNs have either 10 or 13 digits, separated by dashes. They include no letters, but should be prefaced by 'ISBN.'
ISSNs have 8 digits, separated by dashes. They include no letters, but should be prefaced by 'ISSN.'
PubID numbers indicate resources once held in the UCAR (NESL) publications database.
Reports often use a mix of numbers and letters, including NCAR Technical Note numbers (e.g. NCAR/TN-481+STR).

SRef identifies resources associated with the scientific reference linking system SRef. SRef-IDs will include a numerical prefix, an abbreviation indicating the publication name, and a suffix, each separated by forward slashes (e.g. 1680-7324/acp/2006-6-957). Precede the identifier with 'SRef :'.
WMO identifiers have the general form of A1bwnnn or A1bwnnnnn. When this field. Precede the identifier with the prefix 'WMO'.

WOS identifiers include both Roman numerals and letters (e.g. 694EE). When known, enter the WOS ID exactly as it appears on the publication or in the citation or bibliographic record. Precede the identifier with 'WOS'.

donts.practice: Do not preface or follow the text with a number sign, 'Number,' 'No.', or any other generic prefixes.

examples.practice: DOI and Citation/Article: England, S.L. (2010), Modeling of multiple effects of tides on the ionosphere, J. Geophys. Res., 115, A05308, doi:10.1029. In this citation A05308 is the citation/article number and 10.1029 is the DOI.
